items.title: Maths
items.text: I graduated with a first class degree in mathematics from the University of Warwick. I learnt many valuable lessons and developed a strong ability to understand new systems and solve complex problems.

items.title: Python
items.text: Python is the language I am most comfortable with, as I have worked on a number of personal projects (as seen above), and believe I have developed a strong base understanding of the language.

items.title: Algorithms
items.text: Much of my study has been based in developing and assessing algorithms, which stems from the related computer science modules I took at university.

items.title: Japanese
items.text: I have been learning Japanese for over 5 years now, and spent a year abroad at the University of Tokyo from 2018-2019. During that time I passed level N2 of the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (advanced).

items.title: Team working
items.text: During my year abroad I was involved in over a dozen group-based projects, which improved my ability to work cooperatively as a part of team and effectively resolve conflicts that arise between members.

items.title: JS and React
items.text: I picked up JavaScript since I already knew HTML/CSS, and wanted to easily create GUI interfaces for applications I wrote. Since then I have also begun learning ReactJS, which I used to create this portfolio.

items.title: Problem solving
items.text: All the work I did during my degree was underpinned by my ability to solve complex problems, which as a result has been constantly developing. I have found this transfers to programming very naturally.

items.title: Learning skills
items.text: I am passionate about learning new skills and love the feeling of improvement. I have passed level 2 of the HSK Mandarin exam, reached grade 8 in both piano and flute (merit), and was ranked 29th in Japan for Super Smash Brothers Melee in 2019.
